content: © tracy hill 2018 2020 3 work in k2 p2 ribbing pattern for 1 1/2 1 3/4 2 or desired length then bobble loosely in pattern thumb for additional details on how to pick up and decrease stitches for the thumb see the tutorial at the end of the pattern place all stitches from waste yarn on needles picking up stitches as needed across the thumb gap* * picking up extra stitches and then decreasing in the first row or two will help to reduce holes where the thumb joins the hand remove waste yarn attach yarn leaving a long tail it can be used to stitch up any holes when you are finished the k2tbl decrease is recommended as it will twist the picked-up stitches to also help with reducing holes knit one row decreasing as necessary* across the gap to end up with a total of 14 16 18 thumb stitches * you can do additional decreases in the first row of ribbing if that flows more comfortably for the number of stitches you need to reduce work in k1 p1 ribbing for 5 5 6 row or to desired length bobble loosely in pattern weave in ends* and enjoy your mitts * note i really like the method of finishing the last stitch when knitting in the round that cat bordhi demonstrates at the end her video on jeny s surprisingly stretchy bind off https //www youtube com/watch v=pzwknest97o starts at 3 23 waum mitts v 3 © tracy hill 2018 2020 4 © tracy hill 2018 2020 all rights reserved free patterns i have enjoyed and learned from waum mitts v 3 © tracy hill 2018 2020 5 tutorials thumb gusset increases how they work the gusset is designed to grow in between the column of two knit stitches in the setup row you knit the first knit stitch place a marker then use kll to make a new stitch from the first knit column next you do a krl to create a new stitch from the second knit column place a marker and knit the original second knit stitch there are two new stitches nestled between the original stitches after the setup row the new stitches are created from the columns inside the markers in each increase row you ll knit the original stitch slip the marker krl work all the stitches up to the next marker kll slip the marker and knit the second original stitch there will be an even number of stitches between the markers in this photo taken after the second increase the first increase after setup the 4 increases are marked with blue dots two stitches come out of one stitch below there are now 4 stitches between the markers the green lines
